summary: Jeffrey Epstein's last will and testament, signed and witnessed on November 18, 2014, in which he leaves his entire estate to the trustees of The Jeffrey E. Epstein 2014 Trust and appoints Darren K. Indyke, David Mitchell, and James E. Staley as executors, with Lawrence H. Summers as a successor executor.

events.title: Execution of Epstein's Will
events.description: Jeffrey Epstein signed and executed his last will and testament, witnessed and notarized in the US Virgin Islands.

events.title: Creation of The Jeffrey E. Epstein 2014 Trust
events.description: The trust agreement referenced in the will was dated November 2014, into which Epstein's entire estate is to be transferred.

locations: Little St. James Island, St. Thomas, United States Virgin Islands
Territory of the United States Virgin Islands, Division of St. Thomas and St. John
keyFacts: Jeffrey Epstein's entire estate is bequeathed to the trustees of The Jeffrey E. Epstein 2014 Trust, created in November 2014.
Epstein appointed Darren K. Indyke, David Mitchell, and James E. Staley as executors, with Lawrence H. Summers as a successor executor.
Each executor is to receive $250,000 upon completion of probate, with no other compensation for serving as executor.
The will includes a 'no-contest' clause, disinheriting any beneficiary who challenges the will or trust.
The will was signed and notarized on November 18, 2014, in the US Virgin Islands.
